Articles.Content: I've been playing ksp for almost 2 years now and I feel like I have been doing something wrong. In IVA, am I supposed to use the arrow keys to look around? It just goes really slow when I use them... Thank you ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Right click once and move the mouse around to control where you're looking, scroll the mouse wheel to zoom in, right click again to stop. Hope that helps! Oh, and don't forget to hit "C" or "V" to get out of IVA.
Right mouse works, but not as in the rest of the game: it's a right click to *toggle* between mouse movement and cursor control.

as others have said, right click once, mouse now controls free look, right click again and you'll stay looking in which ever dir your currently facing. Double click on a window (not all windows, but most) and you'll kinda lean forward (nose against glass) so you can peer out a bit better (but then you can't see the nav-ball). double click again (i think) or press c to return to normal IVA view. mouse wheel gives you telescope-level zoom!
